TextView.android:text: \u2022 In present times, the four pillars of learning as envisioned by UNESCO are regarded as the fundamental principles for reshaping education. \n\u2022 The four pillars are:

Learning to know is focused on how an individual thinks, processes information, improves concentration and memory. Basically it deals with cognitive tools required for comprehension. This is very efficiently nurtured through formal education in schools and colleges and through it is laid down an appropriate and adequate foundation for future learning.

Learning to do is focused on how to use education in real life settings and how can one adapt it to future. Basically it deals with providing the skills that would enable individuals to effectively participate in the global economy and society.

Learning to be is focused on the skills that provide support system for ones cognitive skills and transfer of learning. Basically it deals with providing self-analytical and social skills to the individuals to enable them to develop psycho-socially, affectively as well as physically to their fullest potential.

Learning to live together is focused on the skills that provide support for mutual understanding and progress. Basically it deals with inculcating in the values of democracy and respect and peace at all levels of society.

• Another aspect which is being focused upon in the field of Education is Life Skills. 
• We, at Sannibh Technologies clearly perceive this and our services and programmes are designed and delivered to the individuals in such a way so as to strengthen the pillars of education by focusing on development and enhancement of life skills. 
• The International Bureau of Education defines life skills as personal management and social skills which are necessary for an adequate functioning on an independent basis. 
• Relating the four pillars of education with life skills and trying to derive some kind of understanding, points towards having a mixture of knowledge, behaviour, attitudes and values in an individual to reach a goal. 
• Our Training Programmes, Workshops and Mentoring Programme have been built up and designed to focus upon the Learning to know domain specifically catering to the learning to do domain. 
• The Objective of the Finishing School is to offer courses designed specifically to cater to the domain of learning to be and learning to live together which are of utmost importance in the present times as they have become pre-requisites for successful performance. Soft skills are becoming increasingly valuable along with hard skills for graduates trying to navigate todays workplace. 
• They matter a lot as they help individuals thrive in a rapidly changing technological world.

\n\nGetting organized in the normal routines of life and finishing little projects you have started is an important first step towards realizing larger goals. If you cannot get a handle on the small things, how will you ever get it together to focus on the big things?
